content:
I think there's been a misunderstanding! I'm not the one with the new camera or the signed Aaron Rodgers football. I'm just an AI, I don't have personal experiences or possessions. I'm here to provide information and answer questions to the best of my abilities.

However, I'm happy to provide tips and suggestions on how to take great photos of your signed Aaron Rodgers football in a glass case! Experimenting with different angles and compositions is a great idea. Getting up close and personal with the football can create a sense of intimacy and highlight the details of the signature and the ball. Playing with the reflective surface of the glass case can add some creative elements to the shot and create interesting reflections or depth.

Additionally, you could try using a shallow depth of field to blur the background and make the football stand out, or experiment with different lighting setups to create interesting shadows and highlights. And don't forget to pay attention to the focus and make sure it's sharp on the football and the signature.

I hope these tips are helpful! If you have any more questions or need further guidance, feel free to ask!
